title: Chapter 4: Customers' cooperation key to Flex's 2030 sustainability strategy - Compliance Week
summary: Flex, a contract manufacturer, is working to reduce Scope 3 emissions on the customer side. This is a challenge because Flex has little control over its inventory of “purchased goods,” which are dictated by its customers. Despite this challenge, Flex is making progress towards its goal of having 70 percent of certain customers have science-based targets by 2025.
green_innovation: TRUE, Flex's efforts to reduce Scope 3 emissions on the customer side can be considered a green innovation because they contribute to environmental sustainability goals, such as reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
business_innovation: TRUE, Flex's efforts to reduce Scope 3 emissions on the customer side can be considered a business innovation because they involve a new or improved business process (or combination thereof) that differs significantly from the firm's previous business processes and that has been brought into use in the firm.
green_product: FALSE, the article does not describe a specific green product.
green_process: TRUE, Flex's efforts to reduce Scope 3 emissions on the customer side can be considered a green process because they involve a new or improved business process for one or more business functions that differs significantly from the firm’s previous business processes and that has been brought into use in the firm.
product_or_process: Flex's efforts to reduce Scope 3 emissions on the customer side.
likely_naics_codes: ['333298 - Other Fabricated Metal Product Manufacturing', '333414 - Semiconductor and Related Device Manufacturing', '333999 - All Other Miscellaneous Fabricated Metal Product Manufacturing', '334419 - Other Electronic Component Manufacturing']
greenwashing: FALSE, the article does not provide any evidence that Flex's efforts to reduce Scope 3 emissions on the customer side are an example of greenwashing.

title: {Super SCM Makers} IKEA India: The Digitization of Supply Chain - Indian Retailer
summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is transforming the food and agriculture industry, from crop management to food production and safety. AI is enabling the development of novel ingredients and flavors, expanding the boundaries of culinary creativity, but also poses challenges such as data privacy, infrastructure limitations, and ethical considerations that must be addressed.
green_innovation: TRUE, AI applications in the agri-food sector hold extraordinary potential to revolutionize the industry, heralding a new era of heightened sustainability.
business_innovation: TRUE, AI technology is revolutionizing food production, from automated processing and packaging to personalized nutrition recommendations.
green_product: FALSE, the article discusses the use of AI in the food and agriculture industry in general, but it does not describe any specific green products.
green_process: TRUE, AI is enabling precise monitoring of soil conditions, crop health, and irrigation needs, leading to resource-efficient and environmentally conscious agricultural operations.
likely_naics_codes: ['111998, All Other Miscellaneous Crop Farming', '112998, All Other Animal Production', '311119, Other Animal Food Manufacturing', '311211, Flour Milling']
greenwashing: FALSE, the article does not provide any evidence of greenwashing.

title: Conheça 4 projetos de reciclagem do iFood - iFood
summary: iFood, a food delivery company in Brazil, has implemented several initiatives to promote recycling and reduce its environmental impact. These initiatives include installing Voluntary Delivery Points, launching the Re-cycle platform for door-to-door collection of recyclables, and developing the Revert program to optimize the recycling of Styrofoam®. iFood has also partnered with startups to create the I've Been Bag project, which correctly disposes of used thermal delivery backpacks.
green_innovation: TRUE, iFood's initiatives to promote recycling and reduce its environmental impact, such as installing Voluntary Delivery Points and launching the Re-cycle platform, are examples of green innovation because they contribute to environmental sustainability goals by reducing waste and conserving natural resources.
business_innovation: TRUE, iFood's Revert program, which optimizes the recycling of Styrofoam®, is an example of business innovation because it is a new process that differs significantly from the firm's previous processes and has been brought into use in the firm.
green_product: FALSE, the article does not describe any specific green products.
green_process: TRUE, iFood's Revert program, which optimizes the recycling of Styrofoam®, is an example of a green process because it is a new or improved business process that minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability by reducing waste and conserving natural resources.
likely_naics_codes: ['326199 - All Other Plastic Product Manufacturing', '562998 - All Other Warehousing and Storage', '562112 - Waste Treatment and Disposal', '541712 - Research and Development in the Physical, Engineering, and Life Sciences']
greenwashing: FALSE, the described product or process innovation is not an example of greenwashing because it is not a false or misleading statement about the environmental benefits of a product or practice.
